content: the zulip interface doesn't seem to let me increase the width of the right column with the list of streams
this then means that streams pairs like #t-compiler/wg-prioritization and #t-compiler/wg-prioritization/alerts are indistinguishable in presentation on the right hand side
in the short term, I'm going to check with @Santiago Pastorino about whether we can/should rename the alerts stream in some way to make them distinct

(for me, they are both cut off: #t-compiler/wg-prioriti... and #t-compiler/wg-priori...; they are cut off at different points because the number of unread messages in each differ, by a large amount, so the number of digits in that unread messages box is different widths)
but in general this seems like something that one needs to think about up front when making new zulip streams? That, or the Zulip developers should address it...
It certainly wouldn't hurt to make an Zulip issue about it, even if we wanted to work around the problem here.

it's not a problem for me because I see t-compiler/wg-prioritization (no ...) and t-compiler/wg-prioritizatio... and then I know that the second one is the alerts one and also if you hover the mouse over you see pointers to it being the alerts one, but yes if it's an issue for others we should probably rename
cc @nikomatsakis as maybe a reason not to prefix with team name for things
or find shorter prefixes
(at the risk of getting more cryptic)
@simulacrum yeah, I considered that
I do think that's a problem
I'm not sure what I think is the best solution :)
I do also see value in having some visible structure
maybe we should file a zulip issue
to start :)
it seems..so eminently fixable
Definitely open an issue, and mention it's from the Rust community.
as a workaround using the t dialog might help somewhat
yeah besides that I remember the colour scheme for both streams which makes it easier to distinguish :stuck_out_tongue:
